headline: Week’s Best: Charles Schwab Is Cutting ETF Fees
summary: Charles Schwab   will reduce the fees it charges on four index exchange-traded funds and split shares on six of its mutual funds, which will lower the price per share.  The fee cuts are modest—between two and four basis points—but Schwab says they will bring the cost of all its equity and fixed-income market cap-weighted index ETFs to less than 10 basis points.  The cuts continue a trend of fee reductions in the industry, and follow similar recent moves by Vanguard and E*Trade.

headline: Charles Schwab stock falls after monthly report shows drop in new accounts
summary: Investing.com -- Charles Schwab (NYSE:SCHW) stock fell 2% after the financial services company released its May monthly activity report showing a significant decline in new brokerage accounts compared to the previous month.
